abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo has requested that Congress give New York billions of dollars in funding to construct new train tunnels under Hudson River, rejecting offer of loan; request is complicated by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's earlier cancellation of tunnel plan that had received federal funding.
lead_paragraph: A loan to build the tunnels, estimated to cost billions, was “not viable,” Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said, urging the government to get money from the Obama administration or Congress.

headline.main: Cuomo Rejects Federal Offer to Lend Money for New Hudson River Tunnels
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Rejects U.S. Plan to Lend Money for Tunnels

snippet: A loan to build the tunnels, estimated to cost billions, was “not viable,” Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said, urging the government to get money from the Obama administration or Congress.
